medical_history.chief_complaint: Incapacitating, progressive diplopia of 18 monthsâ€™ duration.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Symptoms began 18 months prior to the visit, progressively worsening over that period. The patient developed diplopia, proptosis, and early optic nerve impairment.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Clinical diagnosis of cherubism at age 4, underwent three maxillary and mandibular osteoplasties between ages 18 and 24.
medical_history.family_history: Four children: one brother unaffected, one sister with mild changes but no symptoms, one brother with mild lesions that regressed after puberty, one sister with surgical intervention and recurrence that regressed at puberty; parents show no clinical evidence of cherubism.
